questions.text: Why did Native Americans trade with the French rather than the Spaniards?

answers.text: The French recognized that the native americans viewed trading as an alliance between peoples.
The French had items that the Spaniards didn't.
There were significantly more French traders than Spanish.
The French went to the native americans territory to trade.

questions.text: The three main goals of the Bourbon Reforms and European Enlightenment were to

answers.text: streamline merchandise, increase currency, and decrease security.
streamline productivity, regulate trade, and provide security.
streamline security, decrease trade and regulate productivity.
streamline public administration, raise trade productivity and increase security.

questions.text: Who was the Governor of Taos in 1750?
What was the legislation that applied Enlightenment reasoning?
